history.content:
Not hard prerequisite. Probably not since you can easily study selected topics to catch up (barely any). But why would you want to take any upper div before completing at least some lower div classes to provide foundation? (unless you've already learned these elsewhere).

------------------------

This is not a hard requirement. There isn't much linear algebra in Data 100 (at least this Fall) - just basic matrix operations. Also, the instructors have acknowledged that this prerequisite can be fulfilled concurrently.

Not hard prerequisite. Probably not since you can easily study selected topics to catch up (barely any). But why would you want to take any upper div before completing at least some lower div classes to provide foundation? (unless you've already learned these elsewhere).

On Berkeley Academic Guide, DATA 100 is listed to have "Corequisite: Mathematics 54 or Electrical Engineering 16A". Is this a hard requirement or can these classes be taken later? Will I struggle in DATA 100 without either of these classes?
history.subject: DATA 100 - MATH 54 Corequisite?
